data.title: What's This Page About?
data.statement:
You are given a table of contents and a page number [[p]]. Find what that page is about!

The table of contents is listed like this: {{Chapter [[n]]: [[topic]] -- Page [[pageNumber]]}}.
[[n]] is listed in the order of natural numbers. (1, 2, 3, 4, 5, etc.)
[[topic]] is a word (so no spaces).
[[pageNumber]]s are in increasing order.
Here is an example:

Chapter 1: Subject1 -- Page 1
Chapter 2: Subject2 -- Page 7
Chapter 3: SomeRandomStuff -- Page 11
Chapter 4: SomeOtherStuff -- Page 25
Chapter 5: SomeOtherRandomStuff -- Page 40

For this example, if [[p]] was 6, output "Subject1". If [[p]] was 11, output "SomeRandomStuff". If [[p]] was 92, output "SomeOtherRandomStuff".

testCases.title: Test 1
testCases.testIn:
2
Chapter 1: Thing1 -- Page 1
Chapter 2: Thing2 -- Page 16
3

testCases.testIn:

Chapter 2: Thing2 -- Page 4
Chapter 3: Thing3 -- Page 9

data.constraints:
1 ≤ [[n]] ≤ [[x]] ≤ 15
1 ≤ [[pageNumber]], [[p]] ≤ 1,000,000
[[p]] ≥ [[pageNumber]] of Chapter 1
[[topic]] contains English letters and digits only.
All [[topic]]s are distinct.
data.stubGenerator:
read x:int
loop x read s:string(1000)
read p:int

write What is it about?
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[x]] — the number of chapters.
<<Next [[x]] lines:>> A chapter in the form {{Chapter [[n]]: [[topic]] -- Page [[pageNumber]]}}.
<<Next line:>> An integer [[p]] — the page number.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are given a table of contents and a page number p. Find what that page is about!

The table of contents is listed like this: Chapter n: topic -- Page pageNumber.
n is listed in the order of natural numbers. (1, 2, 3, 4, 5, etc.)
topic is a word (so no spaces).
pageNumbers are in increasing order.
Here is an example:

Chapter 1: Subject1 -- Page 1
Chapter 2: Subject2 -- Page 7
Chapter 3: SomeRandomStuff -- Page 11
Chapter 4: SomeOtherStuff -- Page 25
Chapter 5: SomeOtherRandomStuff -- Page 40

For this example, if p was 6, output "Subject1". If p was 11, output "SomeRandomStuff". If p was 92, output "SomeOtherRandomStuff".
Input
Line 1: An integer x — the number of chapters.
Next x lines: A chapter in the form Chapter n: topic -- Page pageNumber.
Next line: An integer p — the page number.
Output
Line 1: The topic of page p.
Constraints
1 ≤ n ≤ x ≤ 15
1 ≤ pageNumber, p ≤ 1,000,000
p ≥ pageNumber of Chapter 1
topic contains English letters and digits only.
All topics are distinct.
Example
Input
2
Chapter 1: Thing1 -- Page 1
Chapter 2: Thing2 -- Page 16
3
Output
Thing1
